item.description:
Tibetfest V Field Trip. This annual festival celebrates the Buddhist nation of Tibet and is dedicated in helping to preserve its endangered culture. Includes Tibetan food and performances, and art and religious items for sale. Location: Goshen Fairground, 116 Old Middle St, Goshen. Goshen Ct $10 admission $5 for children. Google Tibetfest V for more details.

http://www.tibetfest....


CARPOOLING: from Wethersfield (e-mail us for address) & we need 2 volunteers to drive (gas & parking expenses will be shared)

TIME: meeting up @ 9:45 a.m. leaving @ 10 a.m. sharp.

RSVP: it’s necessary for that we know who is going and volunteering, by Friday, 7/24

IMPORTANT: We received news that due to a lack of state grants, this will be the LAST Tibetfest in Ct. We hope you can attend for this unique event.



7/26. New York Buddhist Church & Rubin Museum Field Trip. Leaving: Wethersfield @ 8:15 a.m. English service: 11:30 – 12:30 p.m. followed by lunch in the City. Dharma Talk topic: “Life in this Human Form.” Location: 331-332 Riverside Drive, Manhattan. Then, a visit to Rubin Museum of Art to look at NYC’s most comprehensive collection of Himalayan (Buddhist) Art. We’ll have lunch in NYC.

Buddhist Church http://www.newyorkbud...

Rubin Museum http://www.rmanyc.org...

CARPOOLING: from Wethersfield (e-mail us for address) & we need 2 volunteers to drive (gas & parking expenses will be shared)

TIME: meeting up @ 8:00 a.m. leaving @ 8:15 a.m. sharp.

RSVP: it’s necessary for that we know who is going and volunteering, by Friday, 7/24


IMPORTANT: A number of people are coming to this annual event outside of Meetup.com, from the sangha itself in Middletown. So, just in case you see no one has RSVPed from Meetup assume many are going. E-mail us to confirm event and Ct carpooling location.

Visit our web site @ www.bffct.net

group.name: Buddhist Faith Fellowship in Middletown, Ct

item.name: Tibetfest V Field Trip
